page.title: 03SARRATT
page.content: The first shop on the green at the southern end is the village Post Office Stores. It was once a Bakery prior to becoming a general store with a Post Office counter - part of the Londis chain. In the old bakery bread was baked until about thirty years ago. The building is of brick with pebble dash and a slate roof. Modern services now replace gaslight, pump water,and a cess-pit on the quarter acre site. Since the days of the bakery there have been four owners, the present ones,Mr and Mrs Stevens, being the parents of the village newsagent and confectioner. The store sells most foodstuffs including fresh bread and meat delivered daily. Close to the P.O.Stores is the old butchers shop, now a private house, and between the two is the original butcher's slaughterhouse.
